text: this was soo lloyd roberts doing what
she did best she'd sneak through Syrian
army lines to enter the besieged city of
Homs in 2011 my guide equipped me with a
fake local ID to get of past checkpoints
and told me to pretend to be his deaf
mute filter which suited me fine
Sula Roberts who began her career at ITN
before joining the BBC was an adventurer
who specialized in getting into
difficult places and uncovering abuses
of human rights by repressive regimes in
1994 she filmed this report on the human
organ trade in China describing
prisoners killed to order for the body
parts they could supply her report
infuriated the Chinese authorities and
she was sentenced in absentia to seven
years in jail
it's believed hundreds of foreigners are
coming to China every year for their
kidney transplants to hospitals like
this in Canton that services the Hong
Kong market and that the number is
increasing all the time
sue Lloyd Roberts went to extraordinary
lengths to get stories here in 1997
posing as a clothes manufacturer to
expose abuses in Burma's garment
industry she reported regularly from the
country over many years covering the
carefully controlled elections of 2010
this time the generals have organized
the elections according to the new
constitution to ensure however people
vote they remain in control
the following year salud Roberts got
into North Korea
it's as if shopping for food is a state
secret whenever I ask to go to the
market I got the same response she
managed to get under the skin of the
most closed country in the world at
school children are taught to sing a
song that told them that they have
nothing to envy in the outside world and
that they are the happiest people on
earth they invited us to indulge in the
fantasy but this year sue Lloyd Roberts
became a story herself diagnosed with a
rare form of blood cancer she decided to
go public she recorded a personal video
diary to attract stem-cell donors not
just for herself but for others who need
them too I'm getting very good at
reading my my blood counts now it's
funny how I knew nothing about
hematology four months ago and now I
reckon I'm a bit of an amateur expert
during a remission in her illness sue
Lloyd Roberts was back at work reporting
on the plight of year ZD women and girls
taken as captives by Isis fighters the
three girls are very beautiful with an
aura of sadness about them despite their
age and a kind of deadness in their eyes
which isn't surprising when they start
telling you what happened to them
Sula Roberts was a campaigning
journalist who'll be remembered for
finding unique ways of telling stories
of human suffering that might otherwise
not have been told
you
